title: Is Sweden in the Euro? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, Sweden is a part of Economic and Monetary Union of the European Union (EMU) No, Sweden is not currently using the Euro notes, but the euro can be used to pay for goods and services in many places in Sweden and most banks provide Euro based accounts.
Nope. 150 years ago, Denmark, Norway and Sweden created a currency union. It broke up during the First World War. Coincidentally, these three countries avoid joining the Euro project.
